alert.note: Alert for City of Chesapeake; City of Portsmouth; City of Suffolk (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 30 at 5:02PM EDT until April 30 at 5:30PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 PM EDT FOR ...THE WESTERN CITY OF CHESAPEAKE...THE SOUTHERN CITY OF PORTSMOUTH AND THE SOUTHEASTERN CITY OF SUFFOLK... At 501 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Chesapeake, or 7 miles southwest of Deep Creek, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and powerlines. This severe storm will be near... Deep Creek and Bowers Hill around 515 PM EDT. Great Bridge and Chesapeake around 520 PM EDT. Cradock around 525 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this severe thunderstorm include Deanes, Herberts Corner, Portlock and Chesapeake Airport. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.

area.areaDesc: City of Chesapeake; City of Portsmouth; City of Suffolk
